Name: Torso of a statue in a tripartite garment
Description: This torso is of a type of male standing statue in a tripartite garment that became popular from the fourth century BC down to the Roman Period. The head, neck and the part below the hips are gone, as is a part of the right lower arm. The front and back show severe abrasions. The figure has a wide and very plain back pillar with triangular tip.
